poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Real-World Finance Core Unit - RWF-001 (MIP39c3-SP5) - October 10, 2022

discourse_list.title: MIP39c3-SP5: Offboarding the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001)

content.content: MIP39c3-SP5: Offboarding the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001)  Preamble MIP39c3-SP#: 5 Author(s): @rune Contributors: @juan, @retro Tags: core-unit, RWF-001, cu-offboarding Status: Accepted Date Applied: 2022-09-07 Date Ratified: 2022-10-24 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip39c3-sp5-offboarding-the-real-world-finance-core-unit-rwf-001/17753 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmX68eHn   Sentence Summary This subproposal offboards the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001).  Specification  Core Unit ID RWF-001  Motivation MakerDAO is restructuring the work and the workforce across the DAO according to the Endgame Plan. The mandate for the Real-world Finance Core Unit will be better aligned within a cluster of a MetaDAO. As a result, this Core Unit must be offboarded to support the transition.  Core Unit Work Continuity All activities associated with RWF-001 will be supported by SF-001 and the subproposal MIP39c2-SP36.  Mandated Actor Status The facilitator will have their mandated actor status removed.  Unwinding Activities & Golden Parachute  DAI     Detail Amount (DAI)     September’s CU commitments 100,000   October’s CU commitments (24 days of Facilitator compensation) 16,000   Golden Parachute 60,000   Total 176,000     MKR Any MKR accrued (vested or not) at the time of this MIP’s ratification will be eligible for payout. If the MKR Incentive Plan has a cliff, it will be ignored and allow the MKR amount to be transferred to the Core Unit.     Detail Amount (MKR)     Will MKR for end of June quarter 20   Will MKR for end of September quarter 20   Will MKR for October (1-24) 5.26   Will retroactive MKR for Foundation 60   Eric retroactive MKR 48.1   TJ retroactive MKR 48.1   Total 201.46     Golden Parachute A Golden Parachute payout will be provided to the Core Unit for the benefit of the outgoing Facilitator. The Golden Parachute amount is 60,000 Dai. If the spend from the Auditor wallet has exceeded the amounts specified above at the moment this MIP is passed and the offboarding occurs, the Effective Golden Parachute amount is reduced by an amount equivalent to the excessive spending.  Budget Implementation Upon ratification of this proposal:  All DAI DssVest streams will be terminated. All MKR DssVest streams will be terminated. Amounts will be paid by the Auditors to the Operational only if the corresponding reports have been provided, and the amount spent by the Core Unit falls within the approved MIP40 budgets by Maker Governance. The remaining amount will be returned by the Auditors directly to using DssBlow. Any amount of DAI over the Effective Golden Parachute amount in the Core Unit’s Multi-sig wallets will be returned to the protocol using DssBlow by the date of the following Executive Vote, or Governance will withdraw the funds in the Executive Vote using the MCD_Pause_Proxy beneficiary role on the multi-sig. If the Effective Golden Parachute amounts is above the current balance in the Core Unit’s Multi-sig wallets, the following Executive Vote will distribute the difference to the Core Unit.
content.GPT-summary: This post is a subproposal that offboards the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001) as part of MakerDAO's restructuring plan. The post provides details on the Core Unit's work continuity, mandated actor status, and unwinding activities, including a Golden Parachute payout. The post also outlines the budget implementation plan upon ratification of the proposal. The post does not include any request for feedback, collaboration, or advertising, and there are no questions asked about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: MIP39c3-SP5: Offboarding the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001) This post is a summary of the MIP39c3-SP5 subproposal, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This subproposal aims to offboard the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001). Upon ratification, all DAI and MKR DssVest streams will be terminated. The Facilitator will lose the mandated actor status. To ensure “Core Unit Work Continuity”, MIP39c2-SP36 modifies the Strategic Finance Core Unit’s Mandate to cover all activities associated with RWF-001. This subproposal includes a Golden Parachute of 30,000 DAI and 18.3 MKR to be distributed among Core Unit members by the current Facilitator. If the amount of DAI in the Core Unit’s multisig wallet exceeds the Golden Parachute amount (30,000 DAI total), the difference must be returned using DssBlow or will be withdrawn via the MCD_Pause_Proxy. If the amount of DAI in the Core Unit’s multisig wallet is lower than the Golden Parachute amount, the next available Executive Vote will distribute the difference to the Core Unit. This proposal has been assigned High-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2022-09-24

I voted against the MKR Pro-Rata Vesting for former RWF-001 Members because I did not want to create precedence for ignoring the cliff for early leavers. If we are fine with ignoring the cliff for the facilitator, we should treat @teej and @Eumenes equally. Not sure if this can be even done within this offboarding proposal…
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Just to be clear on cliff. The cliff for the facilitator is different. I started officially working for MakerDAO (Foundation) under the grants programme in July 2020. And for the RWF CU from 1 April 2021. So as a DAO contributor my one year cliff within RWF was in 31 March 2022. After that there are quarterly cycles for unvesting of accumulated MKR. Next unvesting cycle will be in Oct 2022. This proposal is not accurate in that regard. The other afore mentioned contributors started operating for RWF CU in Sept 2021 and ended their contributions to RWF CU in 3 Aug 2022. P. S. : The retroactive MKR payment for the period of July 2020 to April 2021 was never charged for. It needs to be included in the MIP. See precedent here for retroactive payment → MIP40c3-SP25: Risk Core Unit MKR Compensation (RISK-001) cc: @rune
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Reminder that this proposal will enter its Frozen Period on Wednesday, September 28 at 23:59 UTC. Substantive modifications beyond that date will render the proposal ineligible for the upcoming Governance Cycle / reset its Frozen Period, as the case may be.
I have a made small correction by editing the Dai numbers in the table to correctly reflect the Golden Parachute amount as defined in the Golden Parachute section
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: rune:  I have a made small correction   We do not allow changes after the frozen period, but GovAlpha supports the view that this is a correction not a substantive change to the proposal. Before the frozen period was over, Rune had indicated that the Golden Parachute amount would be 60k. This discrepancy would have been necessary to address if the proposal passed, and doing it now just clarifies what is being voted on before the vote takes place. As always, feel free to reach out to @Patrick_J, @MIP-Editors, or me if you have questions or concerns on this procedural decision.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: there are a couple of things I find a bit weird, and things are more complicated as they appeared pretty close to the freeze…  not sure why there needs to be MKR for the time in foundation. Most of the contributors during foundation time did not get a retroactive MKR comp (with few exceptions like @rema @Primoz and @LongForWisdom ) but I know of a handful of others who don’t. It would be a lot better if this would not be done within an offboarding proposal Eric and TJ have different durations being on the payroll, still receiving the same amount of MKR we had some MKR transfers for RWF-001 in the recent execs (here, here) - feels to me as we are double spending here?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I will echo @ultraschuppi concern that paying MKR for pre-CU activities seems quite off. @williamr was working for Risk and the Risk pre-CU MKR was settled clearly. Then @williamr worked for the RWF Working group with me to establish the RWF-001 CU. Therefore, if such MIP is approved, I guess I should take it as a signal to ask retroactive MKR for myself? Same for anyone that think could have such a claim?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: SebVentures:  Therefore, if such MIP is approved, I guess I should take it as a signal to ask retroactive MKR for myself? Same for anyone that think could have such a claim?   Absolutely. I believe you have a claim to time worked for the Foundation, as anyone that worked for the Foundation like the Risk team and was retroactively compensated in Aug 2021, way after the CU framework was put in place. I made clear in my comment that i was not included in the retroactive MKR compensation for Risk CU. In a way it made sense as my direct client was the Foundation (Grants Programme), not the Risk team. However, the precedent is there. And I was in exactly the same situation as other Risk CU contributors at the time. So I fail to see why the treatment should be any different.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: ultraschuppi:  we had some MKR transfers for RWF-001 in the recent execs (here , here ) - feels to me as we are double spending here?   There is no double counting. These two polls were for unvesting cycles relative to June end quarter and Sept end quarter respectively. When delivered these MKR go to the auditor wallet, not to the Ops wallet or to their end destination (ie contributors). Currently, that is where the MKR sits when released through spells. The MKR table simply acknowledges those MKR dues to their end destination (ie contributors), rather than double count them. Auditor MKR address
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I am formally submitting this MIP for the October governance cycle. (Have to put in some random filler words to be allowed to post this apparently)
